required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Safety and Immune Response of a Meningococcal Vaccine Administered to Healthy Children
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Single-blind, Controlled, Single-Center Study to Compare the Safety and Immunogenicity of One Dose of Chiron Meningococcal ACWY Conjugate Vaccine With One Dose of Licensed Meningococcal ACWY Polysaccharide Vaccine Administered to Healthy Children 2-10 Years of Age and an Open-label Study to Assess the Safety and Immunogenicity of One Dose of Chiron Meningococcal ACWY Conjugate Vaccine Administered to Healthy Toddlers 12-23 Months of Age

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of Novartis (formerly Chiron) Meningococcal ACWY Conjugate Vaccine administered to healthy children ages 1 - 10 years

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects (2-10 Years of Age) With Human Serum Bactericidal Activity (hSBA) Titers ≥1:4 After Receiving Either MenACWY-CRM or MenACWY-PS Vaccine
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects (2-10 years of age) achieving with hSBA titers ≥1:4 against Neisseria meningitidis serogroups A,C,W and Y, one month after receiving one dose of either MenACWY-CRM vaccine or MenACWY-PS vaccine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects (2-5 Years of Age and 6-10 Years of Age) With hSBA ≥ 1:4 After Receiving Either MenACWY-CRM or MenACWY-PS Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of subjects (2-5 years of age and 6-10 years of age) with hSBA ≥ 1:4 directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y, one month after receiving one dose of either MenACWY-CRM vaccine or MenACWY-PS vaccine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects (12-23 Months Old) With hSBA Titer ≥ 1:4 After Receiving MenACWY-CRM Vaccine Compared With Percentage of Subjects (3-5 Years Old) With hSBA Titer ≥ 1:4 After Receiving MenACWY-PS Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects (12-23 months old) with hSBA ≥ 1:4 directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y after receiving one dose of MenACWY-CRM vaccine compared with percentage of subjects (3-5 years old) with hSBA ≥ 1:4 after one dose of licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine.

secondary_outcome.measure: hSBA Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) in Subjects (2-10 Years of Age) After Receiving Either MenACWY-CRM Vaccine or MenACWY-PS Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: hSBA GMT against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W, and Y, in subjects (2-10 years of age), one month after receiving one dose of either MenACWY-CRM vaccine or the licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine.

secondary_outcome.measure: hSBA GMT in Subjects (2-5 Years of Age and 6-10 Years of Age) Receiving Either MenACWY-CRM Vaccine or MenACWY-PS Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: hSBA GMT against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W, and Y, in subjects (2-5 years of age and 6-10 years of age), one month after receiving one dose of either MenACWY-CRM vaccine or licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine.

secondary_outcome.measure: hSBA Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) in Subjects (12-23 Months Old) After Receiving MenACWY-CRM Vaccine Compared With hSBA GMT in 3-5 Year Old Subjects After Receiving MenACWY-PS Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: hSBA GMT against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W, and Y, in subjects (12-23 months old), one month after receiving one dose of MenACWY-CRM vaccine compared with hSBA GMT in 3-5 year old subjects after receiving one dose of licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects (2-10 Years, 2-5 Years and 6-10 Years Old) With hSBA ≥ 1:4 After Receiving Either MenACWY-CRM Vaccine or MenACWY-PS Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects (2-10 years, 2-5 years and 6-10 years old subjects) with hSBA ≥ 1:4 directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y, 12 months after receiving one dose of either MenACWY-CRM vaccine or MenACWY-PS vaccine.

secondary_outcome.measure: hSBA Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) in Subjects (2-10 Years, 2-5 Years and 6-10 Years Old) After Receiving Either MenACWY-CRM Vaccine or MenACWY-PS Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: hSBA GMT against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W, and Y, in subjects (2-10 years, 2-5 years and 6-10 years old), twelve months after receiving one dose of either MenACWY-CRM vaccine or MenACWY-PS vaccine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local and Systemic Adverse Events After Vaccination in Children Aged 2 to 10 Years
secondary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine compared to the safety and tolerability of a single dose of licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine when administered to healthy children 2 to 10 years of age.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local and Systemic Adverse Events After Vaccination in Toddlers Aged 12 to 23 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine when administered in healthy toddlers (12-15 months old), alone or concomitantly with PnC and when administered in healthy toddlers (16-23 months old), alone or concomitantly with DTaP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs) After Vaccination in Children Aged 2 to 10 Years
secondary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine compared to the safety and tolerability of a single dose of licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine when administered to healthy children 2 to 10 years of age.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Unsolicited Adverse Events After Vaccination in Toddlers Aged 12 to 23 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine when administered in healthy toddlers (12-15 months old), alone or concomitantly with PnC and when administered in healthy toddlers (16-23 months old), alone or concomitantly with DTaP.

arm_group.description: Subjects received one dose of investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine
Subjects received one dose of investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine
Subjects received one dose of licensed comparator MenACWY polysaccharide (MenACWY-PS) vaccine
Subjects received one dose of MenACWY-CRM vaccine alone or concomitantly with PnC
Subjects received one dose of MenACWY-CRM vaccine alone or concomitantly with DTaP

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Group 1: Healthy children 2-10 years of age;
- Group 2: Healthy toddlers 12-23 months of age; who are up to date with age appropriate immunizations for diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, polio, hepatitis B, Hemophilus influenzae type b, and pneumococcus.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Group 1: Subjects with a previous or suspected disease caused by N. meningitidis; or previous immunization with a meningococcal vaccine or vaccine containing meningococcal antigen(s); Any serious acute, chronic or progressive disease.
- Group 2: Subjects with a previous or suspected disease caused by N. meningitidis or previous immunization with a meningococcal vaccine or vaccine containing meningococcal antigen(s); Any serious acute, chronic or progressive disease.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from a single center.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All enrolled subjects participated in this study.

group.title: MenACWY (2-5 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-cross-reactive material (CRM) conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-PS (2-5 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the licensed MenACWY-polysaccharide vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY (6-10 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-PS (6-10 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the licensed MenACWY-polysaccharide vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY (12-15 Months Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY+PnC (12-15 Months)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine administered concomitantly with pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PnC).

group.title: MenACWY (16-23 Months)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY+DTaP (16-23 Months)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine administered concomitantly with diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis (DTaP) vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-PS (3-5 Years Old)
group.description: Children aged 3 to 5 years receiving MenACWY- polysaccharide (PS) vaccine from the first part of the study (Menomune, not licensed in US in children under 2 years of age) were used as controls for the 12-23-months-old part two toddlers.

group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-PnC (12-15 Months Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine administered concomitantly with pneumococcal conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY (16-23 Months Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY+DTaP (16-23 Months Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine administered concomitantly with DTaP vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY+PS (3-5 YearsOld)
group.description: Children aged 3 to 5 years receiving MenACWY-PS from the first part of the study (Menomune, not licensed in US in children under 2 years of age) were used as controls for the 12-23-months-old part two toddlers.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Subjects (2-10 Years of Age) With Human Serum Bactericidal Activity (hSBA) Titers ≥1:4 After Receiving Either MenACWY-CRM or MenACWY-PS Vaccine
outcome.description: Number of subjects (2-10 years of age) achieving with hSBA titers ≥1:4 against Neisseria meningitidis serogroups A,C,W and Y, one month after receiving one dose of either MenACWY-CRM vaccine or MenACWY-PS vaccine.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on per protocol population i.e. all subjects who received one dose of vaccine and provided serum samples at the relevant time points (day 1, day 29 and day 360) and had no major protocol deviation.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM (2-10 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine

group.title: MenACWY-PS (2-10 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine

measure.title: Number of Subjects (2-10 Years of Age) With Human Serum Bactericidal Activity (hSBA) Titers ≥1:4 After Receiving Either MenACWY-CRM or MenACWY-PS Vaccine
measure.description: Number of subjects (2-10 years of age) achieving with hSBA titers ≥1:4 against Neisseria meningitidis serogroups A,C,W and Y, one month after receiving one dose of either MenACWY-CRM vaccine or MenACWY-PS vaccine.
measure.population: Analysis was done on per protocol population i.e. all subjects who received one dose of vaccine and provided serum samples at the relevant time points (day 1, day 29 and day 360) and had no major protocol deviation.

analysis.groups_desc: Noninferiority of immune responses of MenACWY-CRM to licensed comparator against serogroup A
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: MenACWY-CRM was considered to be noninferior to the licensed comparator if the lower limit (LL) of the 95% confidence intervals (CI) of the difference (MenACWY minus licensed comparator)in the percentage of the subjects with hSBA titer ≥ 1:4 at one month post vaccination was > -10% against each serogroup

analysis.groups_desc: Noninferiority of immune responses of MenACWY-CRM to licensed comparator against serogroup C
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: MenACWY-CRM was considered to be noninferior to the licensed comparator if the lower LL of the 95% CI of the difference (MenACWY minus licensed comparator)in the percentage of the subjects with hSBA titer ≥ 1:4 at one month post vaccination was > -10% against each serogroup

analysis.groups_desc: Noninferiority of immune responses of MenACWY-CRM to licensed comparator against serogroup W
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: MenACWY-CRM was considered to be noninferior to the licensed comparator if the LL of the 95% CI of the difference (MenACWY minus licensed comparator)in the percentage of the subjects with hSBA titer ≥ 1:4 at one month post vaccination was > -10% against each serogroup

analysis.groups_desc: No inferiority of immune responses of MenACWY-CRM to licensed comparator against serogroup Y
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: MenACWY-CRM was considered to be noninferior to the licensed comparator if the LL of the 95% CI of the difference (MenACWY minus licensed comparator)in the percentage of the subjects with hSBA titer ≥ 1:4 at one month post vaccination was > -10% against each serogroup

analysis.groups_desc: Superiority of immune responses of MenACWY-CRM to licensed comparator against serogroup A MenACWY-CRM was considered to be superior to the licensed comparator if the LL of the 95% CI of the difference (MenACWY minus licensed comparator) in the percentage of the subjects with hSBA titer ≥ 1:4 at one month post vaccination was > 0% against each serogroup

Superiority of immune responses of MenACWY-CRM to licensed comparator against serogroup C MenACWY-CRM was considered to be superior to the licensed comparator if the LL of the 95% CI of the difference (MenACWY minus licensed comparator) in the percentage of the subjects with hSBA titer ≥ 1:4 at one month post vaccination was > 0% against each serogroup

Superiority of immune responses of MenACWY-CRM to licensed comparator against serogroup W MenACWY-CRM was considered to be superior to the licensed comparator if the LL of the 95% CI of the difference (MenACWY minus licensed comparator) in the percentage of the subjects with hSBA titer ≥ 1:4 at one month post vaccination was > 0% against each serogroup

Superiority of immune responses of MenACWY-CRM to licensed comparator against serogroup Y MenACWY-CRM was considered to be superior to the licensed comparator if the LL of the 95% CI of the difference (MenACWY minus licensed comparator) in the percentage of the subjects with hSBA titer ≥ 1:4 at one month post vaccination was > 0% against each serogroup

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects (2-5 Years of Age and 6-10 Years of Age) With hSBA ≥ 1:4 After Receiving Either MenACWY-CRM or MenACWY-PS Vaccine
outcome.description: Percentages of subjects (2-5 years of age and 6-10 years of age) with hSBA ≥ 1:4 directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y, one month after receiving one dose of either MenACWY-CRM vaccine or MenACWY-PS vaccine.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on per protocol population. The total number of participants analyzed in the MenACWY-CRM (2-10 Years Old) group (282), is different respect with that reported in the Outcome Measure 1 (281). There, the largest number for each group across the 4 strains was reported (not all strains had a result from the lab-i.e. C strain).

group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine

group.title: MenACWY-PS (2-5 Years Old)

measure.population: Analysis was done on per protocol population. The total number of participants analyzed in the MenACWY-CRM (2-10 Years Old) group (282), is different respect with that reported in the Outcome Measure 1 (281). outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects (12-23 Months Old) With hSBA Titer ≥ 1:4 After Receiving MenACWY-CRM Vaccine Compared With Percentage of Subjects (3-5 Years Old) With hSBA Titer ≥ 1:4 After Receiving MenACWY-PS Vaccine
outcome.description: Percentage of subjects (12-23 months old) with hSBA ≥ 1:4 directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y after receiving one dose of MenACWY-CRM vaccine compared with percentage of subjects (3-5 years old) with hSBA ≥ 1:4 after one dose of licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on per protocol population.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM (12-23 Months Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine

group.title: MenACWY-PS (3-5 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine. This group was a subset of the licensed comparator (2-5 years old) cohort that received one dose of licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects (12-23 Months Old) With hSBA Titer ≥ 1:4 After Receiving MenACWY-CRM Vaccine Compared With Percentage of Subjects (3-5 Years Old) With hSBA Titer ≥ 1:4 After Receiving MenACWY-PS Vaccine
measure.description: Percentage of subjects (12-23 months old) with hSBA ≥ 1:4 directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y after receiving one dose of MenACWY-CRM vaccine compared with percentage of subjects (3-5 years old) with hSBA ≥ 1:4 after one dose of licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine.
measure.population: Analysis was done on per protocol population.

outcome.title: hSBA Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) in Subjects (2-10 Years of Age) After Receiving Either MenACWY-CRM Vaccine or MenACWY-PS Vaccine
outcome.description: hSBA GMT against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W, and Y, in subjects (2-10 years of age), one month after receiving one dose of either MenACWY-CRM vaccine or the licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on per protocol population.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local and Systemic Adverse Events After Vaccination in Children Aged 2 to 10 Years
outcome.description: Safety and tolerability of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine compared to the safety and tolerability of a single dose of licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine when administered to healthy children 2 to 10 years of age.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on safety population i.e. all randomized subjects who received a vaccination and who had follow up safety data.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM (2-5 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine

group.title: MenACWY-PS (2-5 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine

group.description: Subjects received one dose of investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine

group.title: MenACWY-PS (6-10 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local and Systemic Adverse Events After Vaccination in Children Aged 2 to 10 Years
measure.description: Safety and tolerability of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine compared to the safety and tolerability of a single dose of licensed MenACWY-PS vaccine when administered to healthy children 2 to 10 years of age.
measure.population: Analysis was done on safety population i.e. all randomized subjects who received a vaccination and who had follow up safety data.

class.title: Stayed at home due to reactions, N=146,151,154,156

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local and Systemic Adverse Events After Vaccination in Toddlers Aged 12 to 23 Months
outcome.description: Safety and tolerability of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine when administered in healthy toddlers (12-15 months old), alone or concomitantly with PnC and when administered in healthy toddlers (16-23 months old), alone or concomitantly with DTaP.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on safety population.

reported_events.time_frame: Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), AEs leading to premature withdrawal and any medically significant AEs were collected from Day 1 to 360

group.title: MenACWY (2-5 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-PS (2-5 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the licensed MenACWY-polysaccharide vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY (6-10 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-PS (6-10 Years Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the licensed MenACWY-CRM polysaccharide vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY (12-15 Months Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-PnC (12-15 Months Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine administered concomitantly with pneumococcal conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY (16-23 Months Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY+DTaP (16-23 Months Old)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of the investigational MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine administered concomitantly with DTaP vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-PS (3-5 Years Old)
group.description: Children aged 3 to 5 years receiving MenACWY-PS from the first part of the study (Menomune not licensed in US in children under 2 years of ages) served as controls for the 12-23-months-old part two toddlers.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
